titleStmt.title: Die Iovis. 23. Martii. 1643. It is this day ordered by [the] Lords and Commons assembled in Parliament, that no person or persons whatsoever, doe at any time from henceforth buy, sell, or take to pawn or exchange any horse, horses, muskets carabines, ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Parliament.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for John Wright. and are to be sold in the Old Baily,

notesStmt.note: No person is to buy, sell, or take in exchange any horses, etc. stamped with the mark of the commonwealth. -- Steele.
Title includes first lines of text.
With engraved logo of "CL" crossed and topped by a crown at head of document.
Order to print signed: John Browne. Cler. Parl.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
